'Patch.com' is a local news and information platform owned by the AOL
corporation. As of May 2012, Patch operates some 850 local and hyperlocal news
websites in 23 states in the United States. {{cite web |url=
http://www.npr.org/templates/story/story.php?storyId=129238091 |title= AOL Aims
High With Hyperlocal Journalism Project |first= Tamara |last= Keith |publisher=
NPR.com |date= August 17, 2010 |accessdate= August 17, 2010 }} {{cite
news |url= http://www.forbes.com/2010/08/16/internet-patch-news-technology-
aol.html?boxes=Homepagechannels |title= AOL's plan to own your neighborhood
|first=Quentin |last= Hardy |publisher= Forbes.com |date= August 17, 2010
|accessdate= August 17, 2010 }} {{cite news |title= Local News Becomes
Web's New Boom |url= http://www.netnewscheck.com/article/2010/12/09/7680/local-news-becomes-webs-
new-boom-town |first= Michele |last= Chandler |publisher= NetNewsCheck |date=
December 9, 2010 |accessdate= December 27, 2010 }} 'Patch Media
Corporation' is the operator of the service.
